description: The SS7View status poll of the CSG succeeded. This is
generated after a poll to a CSG which previously failed
is now successful.

event.Summary: SS7View status poll of CSG succeeded

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SS7VIEW-MIB::csgStatusPollClear SS7VIEW-MIB::pollSS7ViewHost s EXAMPLE SS7VIEW-MIB::pollSS7ViewIP a 192.0.2.1 SS7VIEW-MIB::pollServerName s EXAMPLE SS7VIEW-MIB::pollServerCLLI s EXAMPLE SS7VIEW-MIB::pollServerIpAddress a 192.0.2.1

description: The CSG Server CLLI name

description: The CSG Server CLLI name
variables.name: SS7VIEW-MIB::pollServerIpAddress

description: The SS7View status poll of the CSG failed. There may be
multiple failure reasons but only the first line of the reason
(up to 50 characters) is shown.
Check the WebNMS/logs/stderr.txt for the complete list of
failures.

event.Summary: SS7View status poll of CSG failed

description: The CSG Server state triplet changed. Based on the state values
SS7View computes that this is a Clear/Normal alarm.

has removed all but the most current few lines of information.

description: Indicates (in Percentage) how full the disk is.

description: Indicates the threshold of diskCapacity.
variables.name: SS7VIEW-MIB::diskThreshold

description: The Trap generated when the disk capacity is greater than
threshold.

description: This trap will notify the dialaccessMap process of changes to an
INC alarm state.
* It is the internal trap used in ss7view, not for browsing.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SS7VIEW-MIB::privateNotifyMap SS7VIEW-MIB::incSelectionName s EXAMPLE SS7VIEW-MIB::alarmRaise i 0

description: Identifies INC selection name.
*It is the internal variable used in ss7view.
variables.name: SS7VIEW-MIB::incSelectionName

description: Indicates if the INC alarm is raised or not
0 = clear
1 = raise
2 = state
*It is the internal variable used in ss7view.
variables.name: SS7VIEW-MIB::alarmRaise
